Articles.Content:
Version: 0.90 Windows 64 bit

Problem: Can't select "Resume Saved" for any saved games on the menu screen (Save files still in the folders), also infrequent crashes to desktop.

Mods installed:

http://gyazo.com/6e1171be2ddf071ce0cc3121fbd00535

MechJeb 2.4.2

KW Rocketry 2.6d

KAS 0.4.10

Kerbal Engineer Redux 1.0

Station Science 1.4

Kerbal Alarm clock 3.2.3.0

Chatterer 0.8.1

Dmagic 0.9.1.1

Stage Recovery 1.5.3

(Up to date as of 30/01/2015)

Description:

  • Load game
  • Select menu options until presented with "Resume saved" "Start new" etc.
  • Can click "Resume saved" but it doesn't result in any action.

(The crashes also happen randomly regardless of what action I perform, but it seems others are having this issue also so it's not as important)

Logs:

Output: http://www./view/f2ucf81cjtv8hc2/output_log(3).txt

Save Persistent(Career): Apparently it's empty so I can't upload it to mediafire...

Save persistent (Alternate game save): http://www./download/hf2466u3jco8l8j/persistent(3).sfs

Quicksave(Career): http://www./download/7nq0xnf5xntnwmb/quicksave.sfs

Crash log: https://www./folder/1xdt26ss1i8v1/Crash_Log (Excluding .dmp file as it was apparently empty and wouldn't upload)

Settings: http://www./download/3652iq9gk6uis6i/settings(2).cfg

Any help would be much appreciated as I'd finally managed to get a half decent SSTO working and was in the middle of mapping out a rather ambitious station in LKO

Edited January 31, 2015 by Cybindis

Shameless self bump because game is pretty much broken and semi unplayable due to no ability to play any saved game at all. (This always seems to happen to me on support forums )

Update: More woe has befallen me, my PC has majorly messed up, issues with the bios, freezing (potential HDD/RAM failure) and at the moment I can't see how I'm going to be able to reboot it/recover it as it freezes when I try to recover from windows disk.

So I hope I've given enough information, and at the same time I hope I'll be able to fix it in some other way, if not I'll have to send it for repair, and most likely it'll be wiped and have windows re-installed, in which case this request will become somewhat redundant, unless it's used for a learning experience.

Edited February 1, 2015 by Cybindis

I have exactly the same problem. Pressing "resume save" button doesn't do anything. I reinstalled manually all my mods on a fresh install, imported my career save subfolder and... same problem. But I have no crashes or PC problem, it's just KSP who doesn't want to launch my saved games. One interresting thing, I created a new game with a name already used and it found there was a game save with this name already, even if it couldn't load it on screen when I press "resume save"

Version: KSP 0.9 x86 windows

mods:

errrh... a lot. I lightened some mods from their parts.

Edit: I removed my career save and it appears that I can resume save again. Any explanation about this? How is it possible for a save file to mess up the game?

Edited February 10, 2015 by Vahal

Ok... Happened on ne new save and it starts really to pissed me of since I can't play with this fracking damocles sword above my save file. If someone could take a look at this problem that would be really, really nice cause atm I'm really stoping to play until it's solved. Bored to lose my time on save that will be doomed anytime.

This usually occurs because there is a zero length craft or save file in the folder, or the VAB or SPH folders are missing.

Please look inside your faulty save folder and make sure there is a persistent.sfs, a SPH folder containing craft files, and a VAB folder containing craft files, and that none of these files are empty.

If your persistent.sfs is empty you can copy your quicksave (if any) and rename it persistent.sfs

If a craft file is zero length it will need to be removed, if none of the files are zero length then one may be corrupted, by removing the files one at a time and trying to load the save you should be able to find it.

So, I checked save folder, all my .craft files and to be sure I deleted the last vessel I was building. That didn't work, I removed the other to verify, and didn't work too... so I looked at my persistent.sfs and passed a looooooooooong moment at checking the datas and see if anything was strange and finally a bit bored I did what you said, I removed the persistent.sfs and made a copy of my quicksave.sfs I renamed.

AND IT WORKED! Jeb, Bill and Bob thank you! Me too of course!

On ‎08‎.‎03‎.‎2015 at 5:56 PM, sal_vager said:

This usually occurs because there is a zero length craft or save file in the folder, or the VAB or SPH folders are missing.

Please look inside your faulty save folder and make sure there is a persistent.sfs, a SPH folder containing craft files, and a VAB folder containing craft files, and that none of these files are empty.

If your persistent.sfs is empty you can copy your quicksave (if any) and rename it persistent.sfs

If a craft file is zero length it will need to be removed, if none of the files are zero length then one may be corrupted, by removing the files one at a time and trying to load the save you should be able to find it.

You saved over 600 h of playtime for me. Thx a lot!
Glad I could help
